From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display information about the USB eToken (such as the eToken ID), use the **show usbtoken** command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) One of the ten available flash drives you can choose from; valid values: 0-9. If you do not specify a number, 0 is used by default
(Optional) All configuration files stored on the eToken.

Examples: The following example is sample output from the show usbtoken command:
ATR (Answer To Reset) :"3B F2 98 0 FF C1 10 31 FE 55 C8 3"
[ Table 162 ] (#wp1012116) describes the significant fields shown in the display.
| Token device name | A unique name derived by the token driver. |
| ATR (Answer to Reset) | Information replied by Smart cards when a reset command is issued. |
ExtraInfo: Use the **show usbtoken** command to verify whether a USB eToken is inserted in the router.
